1. Eligibility

Participants: The hackathon is open to individuals who are 18 years or older, currently enrolled in a recognized educational institution, or professionals in the tech industry.

Team Composition: Teams can consist of up to 4 members. Individual participation is also allowed.

Geographic Limitations: SkyHack 2024 is open globally, but submissions must be in English.

2. Registration

Registration Process: Participants must complete the registration before 30 October 2024.

Registration Fee: A non-refundable fee of INR 500 per team is required. Student discounts apply.

Deadline: Registrations must be completed by 30 October 2024.

3. Code of Conduct

Behavior: Participants are expected to behave professionally and respectfully. Harassment or discrimination will not be tolerated.

Collaboration: Collaboration is encouraged, but all work must be original.

4. Project Guidelines

Original Work: All projects must be created during the hackathon, starting on 09 November 2024.

Submission Requirements: Projects must be submitted by 11:59 PM on 10 November 2024 and include a description, code repository, and demo video.

5. Intellectual Property Rights

Ownership: Participants retain full ownership of their projects, but SkyHack 2024 organizers may showcase projects for promotional purposes.

Third-Party Material: Ensure that you have rights to use any third-party material in your project.

Projects will be evaluated based on:
1. Innovation
2. Technical Complexity
3. Impact
4. Presentation
